ygData.subject: RE: Another question
ygData.msgSnippet: That is correct. Our spells, in one way or another do the following: Base Damage + X number of points/llevel after up to Y level Example: Wrath does 198 points
ygData.messageBody:
That is correct. Our spells, in one way or another do the following:
Base Damage + X number of points/llevel after up to Y level

Example: Wrath does 198 points at 29th, 200 at 30, 202 at 31 and 204 at 32.
I just made 33 last night and haven't cast it yet so I am assuming it will
either go to 206 or stay at 204.

Also, it's not only our DD spells, if you check your buffs they go up by a
point or 2 per level as well. Bravery gave me 122hp last level, now it gives
123.

Drizben D'Vorn
Defiled High Priest of Innoruuk
Oblivion Knight of the 33rd Circle

> From: "Levi Kemp" <levikemp@...>
>
> I think that the some of the spells, such as ward and expulse undead get a
>
> plus on the max dmg for every level above the level it was received. Ward
> Undead can only do 35 dmg at lvl 5 but at lvl 10 it can do 40 dmg.
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> expulse undead doesn't do 104 dmg. mine is like 92 or something, but i am
> lvl 30. my Dismiss undead does 152 and my wrath around 200 -204.
>
> Sianne
> 30th Cleric
> Xegony
>
